data.enText: to change the shape, appearance or sound of sth so that it is strange or not clear
a fairground mirror that distorts your shape

data.chText: 他的声音从喇叭里传出来好像失真了。
data.enText: The loudspeaker seemed to distort his voice.
to twist or change facts, ideas, etc. so that they are no longer correct or true

data.chText: 报章常犯歪曲事实的错误。
data.enText: Newspapers are often guilty of distorting the truth.

data.chText: 这篇文章对他的童年作了歪曲的描述。
data.enText: The article gave a distorted picture of his childhood.

data.chText: 耐磨、防变形的新型合金
data.enText: modern alloys that are resistant to wear and distortion

simple_means.memory_skill: dis 分散 + tort 扭曲 → 扭开 → 曲解

ex.enText: His face was distorted with pain.

ex.chText: 在什么情况下金属会变形？
ex.enText: In what condition will metal distort?

synonyms.bx: 指改变某物的外观、声音等使其变得怪异或模糊，也指某物发生此种变化。

ex.chText: 钢架在烈火的高温下开始变形。
ex.enText: The steel frame began to buckle under the intense heat of the fire.
The bumper was buckled by the crash.

synonyms.bx: 指某物因高温、压力等作用而变形。

ex.chText: 这种金属在压力下会变形。
ex.enText: This kind of metal will deform under pressure.

ex.chText: 长时间穿过紧的鞋会使双脚变形。
ex.enText: Wearing tight shoes for long time can deform your feet.

synonyms.bx: 指在外力作用下或外在环境影响下某物的外形发生变化，造成功能或外观受损。

ex.chText: 地板在潮湿的环境里会变得翘曲不平。
ex.enText: The floorboards will warp in a damp environment.

ex.chText: 如果门变形了，你最好买个新的来。
ex.enText: If the door is warped, you'd better buy a new one.

synonyms.bx: 指形状在温度、湿度的作用下发生改变。

tr: alter the shape of (something) by stress
example: His body was deformed by leprosy

tr: make false by mutilation or addition
as of a message or story
affect as in thought or feeling
example: My personal feelings color my judgment in this case

tr: twist and press out of shape

value.def: If you distort a statement, fact, or idea, you report or represent it in an untrue way.

example.ex: The media distorts reality; categorises people as all good or all bad...
example.tran: 媒体会歪曲事实，将人说得不是完美无缺就是一无是处。

example.ex: The minister has said his remarks at the weekend have been distorted.
example.tran: 部长说他周末的讲话被曲解了。

example.ex: These figures give a distorted view of the significance for the local economy.
example.tran: 这些数据会使人误解其对地方经济的重要性。

value.def: If something you can see or hear is distorted or distorts, its appearance or sound is changed so that it seems unclear.

example.ex: A painter may exaggerate or distort shapes and forms...
example.tran: 画家可能会对线条和形状进行夸大或扭曲。

example.ex: His size was persistently distorted by the cartoonists...
example.tran: 漫画家们总是把他画得变形了。

example.ex: This caused the sound to distort.
Sound was becoming more and more distorted through the use of hearing aids.
example.tran: 使用助听器会使声音变得越来越失真。

partsOfSpeech.dec: con 加强 + tort 扭曲 → 扭曲；曲解
con 加强 + tort 扭曲 + ion 表名词 + ist 从事某职业的人 → 柔术演员（能把身体全部扭曲的人）
partsOfSpeech.d: 柔术演员（能把身体全部扭曲的人）

partsOfSpeech.dec: dis 分散 + tort 扭曲 → 扭开 → 曲解
ex 出 + tort 扭曲 → 强扭出来 → 强夺
re 回 + tort 扭曲 → 反着扭 → 反驳
tor〔= tort〕扭曲 + ment 表名词 → 扭的状态 → 苦恼
tors 扭曲 + ion 动作或状态 → 扭转力
tort 扭曲 + uous …的 → 曲折的
tort 扭曲 + ure 表行为 → 扭曲〔别人〕→ 折磨
